meanings.definition: The quality of being clear, transparent, and easily understood.
meanings.sent1: The limpidity of the water in the glass allowed me to see the bottom clearly.
meanings.sent2: The limpidity of her explanation made the complex topic easy to grasp.
meanings.sent3: The limpidity of the situation was so obvious that even a child could understand.
meanings.sent4: Her eyes held a limpidity that revealed her true emotions without any disguise.
meanings.sent5: The limpidity of his writing style made the novel a joy to read.

meanings.definition: The state of being calm, serene, and untroubled.
meanings.sent1: The limpidity of the lake on a quiet morning brought a sense of peace to my soul.
meanings.sent2: Her face showed limpidity as she meditated in the tranquil garden.
meanings.sent3: Despite the chaos around him, he maintained a limpidity of mind that impressed everyone.
meanings.sent4: The limpidity of the sky after the storm was a welcome sight.
meanings.sent5: In the limpidity of the forest, she found solace and relaxation.
